alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:51PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Along The Tanana River Into Next Week... High water continues along glacially fed rivers draining the Alaska Range, including the Delta, Nenana and Tanana Rivers. Warm temperatures are continue to cause enhanced glacial and high elevation snowmelt runoff. Heavy rainfall several days ago in the Alaska Range is also contributing additional water to the Delta, Nenana and Tanana Rivers. Low lying areas along these rivers may fill with water. Increased river bank erosion will occur. The high water will cause elevated groundwater along the Tanana River, with adjacent sloughs and ponds filling with water. The Tanana River at Fairbanks is near minor flood stage and is expected to remain near this level through the weekend. The Rosie Creek subdivision near Fairbanks may see ponding of water over some roads as groundwater rises to the surface.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands
